name: reorientation
content:
reorientation noun
(AIMS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act or process of changing the aim or purpose of something so that it is directed at a different person or thing: There has been a complete reorientation of the company's philosophy. The committee called for a reorientation of the world's economy towards sustainability and equality.
More examplesFewer examplesThere has been a reorientation of Britain's foreign trade away from America and towards Europe.The government should consider a reorientation of its education policy.We have a witnessed a striking reorientation of the country's foreign policy.

reorientation noun
(POSITION)
[ U ] the act of changing the position of something in relation to what is around it: The architect's proposals involved the reorientation of the main hall.
[ U ] the act of becoming familiar with something again, or of knowing where you are: After her time in the city, she found reorientation to village life very challenging. I had no idea where I was and looked for some landmarks that I could use for reorientation.
